alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:26AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Dale and northern Coffee Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1026 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Troy to Glenwood to 10 miles northwest of Dozier. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elba, Fort Rucker, Ariton, Lee, Pine Level, Mixons Crossroads, Dill, Lowry Mill, Camp Humming Hills, Arguta, Wise Mill, Roeton, Clowers Crossroads, Phillips Crossroads, Arcus, Hwy 231 Pea River Bridge, Woodland Grove Church, Jack, Java and Chestnut Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama.
